There is no proven advantage to add vancomycin empirically in an asymptomatic and hemodynamically stable patient with persistent fever and neutropenia    Indications for vancomycin:  - Suspicion of an infection with Gram positivie bacteria (e.g. MRSA and coagulase negative Staphylococcus)  - Positive blood cultures with Gram positivge bacteria before identification and susceptibility results are available    If vancomycin is started empirically, stop it after 2 days if cultures are negative for Gram positive infection.
